Text: What you'd expect of a 70's Thames TV period production. Quality of picture hardly HD but watchable, typically bad set lighting as was the fashion back then but on the whole well performed and interesting from a historical perspective, as was Edward the Seventh which I watched alongside this. Just one WARNING though, that is that the last two episodes are the wrong way around. 6 is labelled "His borrowed plumes" but is in fact 7 "A past and a future". This confused me as I generally skipped the intro to find Jennie was old, died, yet there was still another episode.
I labeled them wrong? Damn - sorry about that. They must have been on reverse order on the DVD.
